alert.note: Alert for Eastern Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 4:40PM EDT until March 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations around 1 to 3 inches, generally for elevation above 1,500 feet. A glaze of ice up to one tenth of an inch from freezing rain is expected along the ridges above 1,500 feet. * WHERE...Augusta, Rockingham, and eastern Highland Counties in Virginia, and eastern Pendleton County in West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Monday. Light snow will mix with light freezing rain and freezing drizzle at times through tonight. Precipitation will change to light rain and drizzle in the valleys. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
